title: Former commercial building in Pittsfield is now a $325K industrial-style home for someone to ‘love’
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: A commercial building at 17-19 Linden St., Pittsfield, transformed into a $324,900 industrial-style residence.
Originally a 1925 grocery store, the building now features three bedrooms and the iconic 'Love' mural.
Updated home includes modern amenities like butcher block countertops, stainless steel appliances, and a private in-law suite.

title: ‘Every single cage is full’: Nearly 100 cats rescued from Rhode Island hoarding situation
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Ninety-seven cats rescued from a 1200-square-foot apartment in Woonsocket, Rhode Island by the RISPCA.
Some rescued cats have illnesses and are undersocialized, requiring medical treatment and behavioral assessments.
RISPCA requests item donations or monetary contributions via Venmo or PayPal to support the cats' care.

title: What Jarren Duran said of trade rumors, reps at DH with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jarren Duran, 29, may face more designated hitter reps as the Red Sox manage an outfield logjam in 2026.
Duran has not been approached about a primary DH role, despite the team's depth in outfield positions.
Duran dismisses offseason trade rumors, highlighting his parents’ persistent curiosity about potential trades.

title: Bruins’ Jordan Harris looking to make hockey more accessible, inclusive in Mass.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jordan Harris, a Boston Bruins defenseman, is working to make hockey more accessible in Massachusetts through his Harris' Huskies program.
Harris partnered with SCORE Boston, a nonprofit providing equipment and ice time to children without access to play hockey.
Harris, recovering from a fractured ankle, aims to inspire youth by sharing his hockey experiences and supporting local community initiatives.

title: When will Jayson Tatum return for Celtics? Bill Simmons makes his prediction.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum's return to the Celtics is speculated for March 1, following recovery from an Achilles injury.
NBC's trailer for a Tatum docuseries and a Celtics vs. 76ers game schedule adjustment suggest an imminent return.
Bill Simmons predicts Tatum could return either March 1 or March 6, based on recent developments.

title: State Police trooper seriously injured after cruiser hit on North Shore highway
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A State Police trooper was seriously injured when his cruiser was hit on I-95 South in Salisbury.
The driver, Josue Levi Cuevas Santana, 24, faces charges including negligent operation and using a mobile device.
The trooper has been discharged from Portsmouth Regional Hospital to continue recovering at home.

title: Fleet goalie Aerin Frankel sets Olympic record, helps Team USA advance to gold-medal game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Aerin Frankel leads Team USA to a 5-0 win over Sweden, reaching the Olympic gold-medal game.
Frankel sets an Olympic record with three shutouts in a single women's hockey tournament.
Team USA has maintained five consecutive shutout victories, outscoring opponents 36-1 in the Olympics.

title: Woman found dead, search for husband suspended after couple falls through ice in Eastham, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A woman died after falling through ice at First Encounter Beach in Eastham on February 14 during a dog walk.
Search for the woman's husband, who also fell through the ice, was suspended after two unsuccessful attempts over the weekend.
Police and fire officials used drones and dive teams in their search; the couple's dog was safely retrieved by family.

title: ‘Just pick up a glove’: Tom Werner was disappointed in Rafael Devers saga
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers was traded from the Red Sox to the Giants in June after refusing to switch positions.
Tom Werner expressed disappointment over Devers' unwillingness to play first base following an injury on the team.
Red Sox officials, including Sam Kennedy, acknowledged potential mishandling of Devers' position change last year.

title: What Sam Kennedy said about Bregman, Devers, and ‘hurtful’ narrative about Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Sam Kennedy addressed concerns about the Red Sox's desire to win, emphasizing ownership's ongoing commitment to success.
Rafael Devers was traded after conflicts over his position, while Alex Bregman signed with the Cubs in free agency.
Kennedy highlighted the Red Sox's $256.1 million payroll as evidence of the team's investment in competing.
